page.title: 01Lunedale in Teesdale
page.content: The area comprises the valley of the River Lune and encompasses a vista of breathtaking natural and unspoilt beauty. The river is bounded by undulating meadows and pastures which rise to high enclosures of bracken, ling or heatherm where skylark, grouse hare and rabbit abound. Buildings are generally of stone with stone slate roofs. Fields of the "Hill Farms" are enclosed with dry stone walls and the farming economy is generally based on the local black faced "Swaledale" breed of sheep and beef or dairy cattle. There is no arable land. Grassholme Reservoir and the disused Greengates Quarries have blended with advantage into the landscape and rural scene.
